title: Physical Science HiSET.S.1.2 (Q5)
prompt: If aluminum has a density of 2.7 g/cm<sup>3</sup>, what is the volume of 2.7 grams of aluminum?
description:
Density is a ratio indicating how much mass is packed into a given amount of space. Gold is very dense. There are 19.3 grams of gold in every cm3 (cubic centimeter). Therefore the density of gold is reported as 19.3 g/cm3. The formula for determining density is:

d = m/V

Where: d = density, m = mass, and V = volume
feedback:
If you understand the formula for density, you will realize that if the density and the mass are the same, the volume is 1 cm3, since density is the amount of mass present in one unit of volume. You can also determine this by using the formula:

d = density = 2.7 g/cm3 m = mass = 2.7 grams V = solving for

This becomes:

2.7 = 2.7/x

multiple both sides by x

2.7x = 2.7

Divide by 2.7

x = 1 cm3
